bibl.title: Moy Wah v. J. C. Drake.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Western Division.
In the matter of the application of Moy Wah for a Writ of Habeas Corpus State of Washington County of Pierce s.s.

Moy Yuck being first duly sworn on his oath deposes and says that he has resided in Portland Oregon for over thirty years last past and is engaged in business in said City at 246 Yanhile St as member of the firm of Hop Wah Lung; Not he is well and personally ac- quainted with Moy Wah and knows that the said Moy Wah is a member of the firm of Gum Wing Chung the dealer in Chinese and Japanese merchandise at 168 Fifth Street in Portland and that he has been a member of said firm for almost nine years last past ; and deponent further says that he is the Moy Yuck who made application on behalf of Moy Wah for a Writ of habeas corpus Court-1 the State of wash-

ington for the County of Pierce and that he made the same for the reason that the said Moy Wah was not informed by the Collector of Customs or the deputy in charge that he would not be allowed to leave until the night of the 8th day of May at about the hour of five o'clock when he was informed by said Collector of Customs or some other person in charge that he would not be allowed to come ashore but be forced to remain on said vessel Victoria and return to China and that said vessel intended to leave on of the 9th of May at 4 O'clock; and deponent further says that the other members of the firm of Gum Wing Chung & Co are Moy Ling, Leon Gum, and Moy Yuck at 168 Fifth Street in Portland and have been for about three or four years last past and deponent further says to his own personal knowledge that said Moy Wah is a good respectable and bona fide Chinese merchant of The United States for about three or four years deponent stating that he knows him that him as

a merchant and knew him at least eleven years to that time and that he still has and his in said firm and deponent frequently conversed with him and the members of said firm being intimately acquainted with each of his and says that he is a in said firm and as depondent is informed and has are in said firm to the of and that he is still in said . Subscribed and sworn to before me this 7th day of June AD 1893
A notary public in and for Pierce County residing at Tacoma
